title: Images Gallery
description: I created this app for an interview, they asked me to build a gallery. I developed a full-stack solution combining React and Node. In the process, I learned how to implement TypeScript with NodeJS, authentication, route protection, services, and more. It's a simple app, but great practice.

title: Angular Authentication App
description: This application serves as both a learning tool for Angular v18+ features and my first experience with NestJS, a backend framework that simplified much of the NodeJS work. It also covers authentication with guards, defer components, conditional rendering, and managing forms using the FormBuilder.

title: React Portfolio
description: After some time away from React, I returned to it to build an online presence while searching for a job. I created this project as an online CV. The most challenging aspect of the project was implementing the moving background effect. I managed states and applied SOLID principles.

title: Angular + Maplibre
description: This app was fun to build. It was part of an Angular course, but I used MapLibre with Geopify instead, as it was free. I learned how to search on the map, add markers, manage them, and apply effects. Previously I worked with Leaflet, and even if it was similar I liked more MapLibre.

title: Space Invaders
description: I developed the Mythic Space Invader game using Python and the Pygame library. It was fun to create my own game, but also challenging as I had to apply logic for movement, collisions, and more. You can download it from my repo.

title: KGS Music
description: This was my first big project, a Spotify clone using Deezer for songs and NextJS with TypeScript. I used Postgres for the DB and Prisma as the ORM. It was challenging, but I made it work and learned a lot about schemas, endpoints, and APIs and more. This repo is private.
